function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Single-exposure regression analysis used to estimate associations between indoor-outdoor green features and psychological health outcomes.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of associations, leading to incorrect conclusions about the impact of green features on psychological health.","Mitigation":"Include multiple exposure regression analysis to account for potential confounding variables and ensure robust associations.","Technologies":"Statistical software for multiple regression analysis.","People":"Researchers, statisticians, and data analysts.","Owner":"Research team and data analysis team."},{"Description":"Inclusion of covariates such as age, gender, education level, working mode, income decrease, presence of other people, and presence of pets in the regression models.","Impact":"Over-reliance on covariates for explaining psychological health outcomes, potentially overlooking the direct impact of green features.","Mitigation":"Consider the potential interaction effects between covariates and green features in the models to disentangle direct and indirect effects.","Technologies":"Advanced statistical methods for interaction effects.","People":"Researchers and statisticians.","Owner":"Research team and statistical analysis team."},{"Description":"Use of beta coefficients as a quantitative measure of the associations between green-related variables and psychological outcomes.","Impact":"Potential misinterpretation of the strength and direction of the associations, leading to erroneous conclusions about the impact of green features on psychological health.","Mitigation":"Provide effect size measures and confidence intervals alongside beta coefficients to improve the interpretation of the associations.","Technologies":"Statistical software for effect size calculation.","People":"Researchers, statisticians, and data analysts.","Owner":"Research team and data analysis team."}]}
